column2: StackStorm (aka "IFTTT for Ops") is event-driven automation for auto-remediation, security responses, troubleshooting, deployments, and more. Includes rules engine, workflow, 160 integration packs with 6000+ actions (see https://exchange.stackstorm.org) and ChatOps. Installer at https://docs.stackstorm.com/install/index.html. Questions? https://forum.stackstorm.com/.

Merge pull request #4736 from StackStorm/fix-orquesta-cancel

Allow cancel to proceed if workflow execution is not found or completed

Handle unknown except during cancelation

Instead of rethrowing the exception, capture and log the error and traceback, and return the error in the result. Then let the cancelation continue to process children and determine final status. If the exception is rethrown, the workflow execution will be stuck in a canceling status. Add unit test to cover this scenario.

Allow cancel to proceed if workflow execution is not found or completed

Allow the workflow execution cancelation to proceed even if the workflow execution is not found or completed otherwise the method will raise an exception and the workflow execution will be stuck with a canceling status.

Add unit tests for disabling orphaned workflow executions gc

Add unit tests to test whether the garbage collection for canceling orphaned workflow executions is disabled by setting gc_max_idle_sec to zero.

Disable gc for orphaned workflow executions by default

Orphaned workflow executions are not common. Disable this gc feature by default and let users knowingly enable it.

Fix logic in identifying orphaned workflow executions

In the query to identify task executions, add id__ne filter so that the action execution for the workflow execution is not included.  This fixes the case where there is no task executions for the workflow execution. If there are task executions for the workflow execution, fix the if statement that identifies if there is any active tasks and if there are not active tasks whether the most recently completed task has passed expiry datetime.

Merge pull request #4720 from StackStorm/fix-to-yaml-str

Fix expression function to_yaml_string to handle mongodb base types

Use if-elif instead of multiple if statements to check types

Use if-elif instead of multiple if statements to check types when converting from MongoDB BaseDict and BaseList to python dict and list types. Once the value is converted, use another if-elif block to recursively evaluate and convert the values of dict and list.

Fix expression function to_yaml_string to handle mongodb base types

Refactor the filter to_yaml_string used in YAQL/Jinja expressions to be able to handle mongodb base types such as BaseDict and BaseList. The filter will call a helper function to recursively convert BaseDict and BaseList to python dict and list respectively.

Merge pull request #4711 from StackStorm/orquesta-unhandled-errors

Fix workflow service to handle coordinator and database errors

Refactor log messages in garbage collector

Clean up and normalize the log messages and how they are coded in the garbage collector.

Add changelog entry for the workflow service error handling fix

Add changelog entry for the workflow service fix to handle unexpected coordinator and database errors.

Fail task execution on workflow engnine process failure

If the message type is ActionExecutionDB and there is an exception on processing the message in the workflow engine, then fail the task execution associated with the action execution. This sets up the workflow execution to be able to rerun from failed task(s).
Add comment to gc routine to explain why workflow is canceled instead of failed

Fix minor issue with not specifying key for optional argument

Fix minor issue with use of the sorted method where the name of the "key" argument is not provided in the method call.

Fix the query used to find action executions for workflow tasks

Use an indexed attribute workflow_execution instead of the workflow execution under the context. The fix uncovered other errors with client side sorting of the result. The fix for these errors are included.

Add step in garbage collector to clean up workflow orphans

Add a step in the garbage collector to look for workflow orphans, workflow execution that has running status but have been idled without any task executions for some time. The garbage collector will cancel these workflow executions.  Add unit tests to make sure records are identified and canceled correctly.

Add jitter to the database write conflict retries

Add jitter argument to the decorator for retrying from database write conflicts.
Update more affected tests.
Update more affected tests.

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:StackStorm/st2 into various_misc_fixes
Add changelog entry for it.
Add tests for it.

Update st2-pack-install commands so it supports local directories which
are not git repositories (think contrib/core).
Add changelog entries.
Fix lint, update affected tests.

Upgrade to tooz 1.65.0 since previous version relies on old version of
grpcio.

Fail workflow execution when workflow engine process failed

When the process method of workflow engine failed with an unexpected error, catch the exception and fail the workflow execution.

Add config reset to avoid parse conflict

There is a conflict in registering config options in packs tests with the change in when test configs are parsed in st2tests.base.  Add a config reset in st2tests.base after st2common modules are loaded to avoid the conflict.

Update sample config for new workflow_engine options

Ran make configgen to update the sample st2 config file to include the new workflow_engine options.

Add retry decorator to handle connection errors

Add a separate retry decorator to handle coordinator and database connection errors different than the retry decorator for database write conflicts. Include the retry decorator at appropriate locations. Add unit tests to test recovery from connection errors and when retries are exhausted.

Fix with items unit test to avoid race

Add a check to ensure the scheduled items are in running state before canceling the execution. Otherwise, there could be a race where one of the item is not running and the status will be canceled instead of succeeded.

Move sort_wf_runtime_errors function to WorkflowTestCase

Refactor orquesta unit test test_error_handling to inherit from WorkflowTestCase. Move the sort_wf_runtime_errors function to WorkflowTestCase.

Add support for pluggable concurrency for the util.green.shell module.

This way we can use either eventlet or gevent, depending on the

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:StackStorm/st2 into st2_saas
Upgrade pip to latest 19.x version

Disallow decrypt_kv jinja filter for fields marked as secret

This commit addresses the issue where in pack config if fields are marked as
secret: true and if user specifies jinja expression with filter decrypt_kv,
the values are decrypted twice. This is due to the fact that for all fields
marked as secret, the values are auto decrypted. Specifying an additional
decrypt_kv filter causes issue.

The commit raises exceptions if decrypt_kv is specified for any fields marked secret.

Merge pull request #4692 from StackStorm/fix-orquesta-st2kv

Refactor the orquesta st2kv function

Fix lint error in the orquesta st2kv module

Fix a minor lint error in the orquesta st2kv module.

Separate test cases for YAQL and Jinja

Make sure both YAQL and Jinja variants for the orquesta st2kv usage are tested.

Return default only if StackStormDBObjectNotFoundError is raised

Refactor the try block and only return default value if the StackStormDBObjectNotFoundError is raised.

Allow st2kv function to return default for nonexistent key

Add a parameter named "default" for the orquesta st2kv function to return the default value if the key does not exists in the StackStorm datastore. Add unit and integration tests for the feature.

Rename MOCK_ORCHESTRA_CTX to MOCK_CTX in unit tests

Shorten the variable name to give more room for code without extending code to separate line.

Make the parameters for the st2kv function kwargs

Make the parameters for the st2kv function into kwargs to prepare for adding the parameter for default value. The parameter for default value is optional and would have been assigned None by default. The function would have no way to determine when a key does not exists whether to return a default value of None. By making the parameters into kwargs, the function can see if the default key is in the kwargs to determine what default value to return if a key does not exists. The default value can support returning a value of NoneType without being confused whether a default value is set or not.

Fix orquesta st2kv to return empty string and null values

Currently, if the key-value pair in the StackStorm datastore has empty string or NoneType as value, the orquesta st2kv function will return the error that key does not exist. This patch fixes the issue and return the empty string or None value.

Add the policy-delayed cleanup to scheduler bootstrap. The migration script will stay to allow users to manually run it without restarting the scheduler. Reuse function in the migration script. Add unit test to test the cleanup function.

Add migration script to cleanup policy-delayed status

Add migration script to identify executions in policy-delayed status, remove entries from scheduling queue, and change the status to requested.
Minor fixes to log entries

Store original execution start timestamp value in the
original_start_timestamp attribute.

This attribute is not used yet at the moment, but it will be needed if
we want to guarantee FIFO ordering for delayed executions.
Add changelog entry for removing the policy-delayed status

Remove policy-delayed status to avoid bouncing between delayed statuses

Currently, when concurrency policy decide the action execution should be delayed, the action execution status is changed to policy-delayed. The scheduler moves the action execution to delayed status. If there is a lot of traffic and the action execution is continued to be delayed, the bouncing between policy-delayed and delayed causes the log to be inflated with records of the status changes. This patch remove the policy-delayed status altogether and just use the delayed status so there's no constant and unncessary status changes.

Add action execution ID to scheduler log entries

Add the action execution ID to scheduler log entries so that it is easier to filter for troubleshooting.

Merge pull request #4596 from StackStorm/fix_default_config_for_some_services

Fix default config file location for some services

Treat any statsd metric driver related errors as non-fatal.

Underneath, statsd uses UDP protocol which is "fire and forget" which
means all the errors are non-fatal and don't propagate back to the
application. There is an edge case with how statsd library establishes
connection though. If hostname is used instead of an IP address and this
hostname can't be resolved, this DNS resolution error will propagate all
the way up and break the application.

This behavior is of course not desired (all metric related operation
errors should be non-fatal) and this PR fixes that. We simply ignore
those errors and log them.
Merge branch 'master' into fix_default_config_for_some_services

Merge pull request #4595 from StackStorm/fix-orquesta-with-items

Acquire lock in workflow engine before handling action execution completion

Acquire lock in workflow engine before handling action execution completion

Acquire a distributed lock, keyed on workflow execution ID, in the workflow engine before handling the action execution completion. This avoids the performance hits from retrying write conflicts for workflows with a lot of parallelism such as a with items task with many items and no concurrency.

Merge pull request #4587 from StackStorm/add-cache-control-header

Add cache control header
Adding changelog entry for cache-control

Adding cache-control constant and test

This commit adds cache control unit test to ensure it is set properly in
responses, as well as sets cache control setting as a constant.

Adding cache control header

For various integrations ST2API should properly tell the client how to
handle caching. This is especially true for ST2Web and ST2Flow. This
commit adds cache-control header and sets the header to `no-cache`. This
way clients always go back to ST2 for their information instead of using
cached data.

Merge pull request #4577 from StackStorm/return-proper-cors-value

Fix improper CORS return

Fix improper CORS return

Prior to this commit if you sent a request from an origin not listed in
`allowed_origins` we would respond with `null` for the
`Access-Control-Allow-Origin` header. Per
[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Access-Control-Allow-Origin#Directives](mozilla's documentation)
null should not be used as some clients will allow the request to go
through. This commit returns the first of our allowed origins if the
requesting origin is not a supported origin.

```
because it couldn't import records with the requested ID.

Add changelog entry.

Update service_setup service entry / bootstrap code so we exclude log
messages with log level "AUDIT" if log level is set to INFO or higher.

This way we avoid issues with duplicate AUDIT messages in production
deployments.

In production deployments default log level is set to INFO which means
that all service log files will also contain AUDIT log messages because
AUDIT level if the highest.

This is not desired, because we already log AUDIT log messages in a
dedicated AUDIT log file.

NOTE: Audit messages will still go in the service log file is log level
is set to DEBUG (that's desired during debugging).
In those cases we are only interested in timing information.

This commit adds the AMQP package to st2common. In a recent update to
py-amqp (https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/pull/214) there was an
additional check added that uses a rabbit capability that is not
available in the rabbit version shipped in RHEL 6. Even though we pin
the correct version of py-amqp in our fixed-requirements.txt the lack of
any package directly requiring it allowed it to be skipped when building
final requirements.txt. Adding the requirement to st2common will make
the correct pinned version show up in requirements.txt.

Add a work around for tests on Travis being up to 10 times slower.

It turns out that on AMQP publish on Travis, "Channel.open: (504)
CHANNEL_ERROR - second 'channel.open' seen" error is returned almost on
every publish which causes our connection retry wrapper to sleep for 10
seconds and slowing down the tests.

I haven't been able to track down the root cause if this issue yet, but
this workaround should work fine and cause no issues on production.

Fix support for mistral reverse workflows

Reverse workflows require the task_name parameter[1] to indicate which
task is the target task for the workflow (ie what the last task should
be on successful completion of the workflow, all other tasks being
determined by the requirements of the various tasks).

This adds support for the task_name parameter to the mistral runner and
fixes the parameter name in the runner config.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/mistral/latest/api/v2.html#mistral.api.controllers.v2.resources.Execution.params

Rename python_version attribute on PackDB model to python_versions and
make it a list.

This attribute specifies which major Python versions the pack works with
(2, 3).

If this attribute is not specified in pack.yaml, we perform no Python
version compatibility check when installing and registering the pack.

The check can also be skipped by using --force install flag, but that
is at user's own risk and packs are not guaranteed to work.

Merge pull request #4469 from StackStorm/fix-empty-with-items-list

Fix task with items but items list is empty for orquesta workflows

Fix task with items but items list is empty for orquesta workflows

If the items list is empty, on transition to the task with items, orquesta fails to render the action specs correctly. For this use case, the orquesta conductor will now return the task spec with the list of action specs empty. The st2 workflow engine will recognize and handle this appropriately to set the task execution to completion in the conductor as well as the database records to progress the workflow execution to the next task(s).

Allow user to run a subset of pack tests by passing new -m flag to the
st2-run-pack-tests scripts.

For example:

1. Run all tests in a file (module):
   st2-run-pack-tests -j -x -p contrib/packs/ -m test_action_download
2. Run a single test class
   st2-run-pack-tests -j -x -p contrib/packs/ -m test_action_download:DownloadGitRepoActionTestCase
3. Run a single test class method
   st2-run-pack-tests -j -x -p contrib/packs/ -m test_action_download:DownloadGitRepoActionTestCase.test_run_pack_download

Fix race and random failures with unit tests for concurrency policy

Add unit tests for re-run delay

Adding unit test for re-run delay in both st2client and st2api.

Reset the global coordinator on class setup and tear down

In the unit tests for the concurrency policy, reset the global coordinator in setup and tear down. Since we are using the noop coordinator in these tests, if they are not reset on setup, the global coordinator will return the default with zake driver. The reset at tear down is to ensure other tests are not affected.

Fix race and random failures with unit tests for concurrency policy

Fix race and random failures with unit tests for concurrency policy by using the scheduling only mock publisher and handling the processing of the scheduling queue manually. Use the noop coordinator driver to prevent blocking in the process. The lock mechanism should be unit tested elsewhere. The separation of concerns should improve the robustness of these tests.

Adding delay to re-run

This commit adds necessary changes to st2client and st2api to accommodate delay
on re-run of actions.

Move "_wait_on_status" and other execution related test case utility
methods on a new ExecutionDbTest case class.

This offers for a better separation and allows us to only ensure indexes
on the test cases which rely on those methods. This speeds things up and
reduces overhead of creating index for that model on each test case run.

Make sure we ensure indexex for Execution Queue model on each test
setUp() run.

.reset() method drops the collection and deletes indexes and that breaks
other tests which run after that call.

NOTE: We want to ensure indexes as least as possible since it's a very
expensive operation.

By default we do it once per test file, doing it for every test method
in every test file would slow tests down at least 5-10x.

Migrate scheduler to new db queue

This change creates the queuer and queue_handler threads in the
scheduler. The queuer will place live actions on the queue and the
handler will sort and pop items off the queue and schedule for execution.

Adding execution_queue collection and utilities

The execution_queue collection holds executions waiting to be scheduled.
The utilities provide a "sorted pop" type functionality for this collection
for the scheduler as well as a simple utility for appending executions
to the collection. There's also a minor base test enhancement to
simplify resetting DB during testing.

Merge pull request #4424 from StackStorm/fix_py3_issues

Various Python 3 related fixes and changes
Allow user to specify PYTHON_VERSION env variable.
Add a changelog entry.
Add a NOTE on old and deprecated timer options.

Fix an issue with timers engine config options not working as
advertised.

We advertise "timersengine" section as new and preferred way of
configuring timers engine service and "timer" config options are
deprecated.

Because of the way how the code was structured[1], even if user would
specify only "timersengine" section in st2.conf, those options would
not be used, but default options from config.py for "timer" section
would be used.

This pull request fixes that to work as advertised / inteded - "timer"
section should only be used if explicitly specified in st2.conf and
timersengine should have precedence over it.

[1]: https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/0245a18198babafe2ab0abde31791cf526435234/st2reactor/st2reactor/cmd/timersengine.py#L59
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:StackStorm/st2 into fix_py3_issues

Timers engine options are also used by st2notifier so they need to be
registered as common options inside st2common.

Merge pull request #4423 from StackStorm/fix-orquesta-post-run

Invoke runner post run on completion of orquesta workflows

Invoke runner post run on completion of orquesta workflows

The runner post_run contains additional logic to process completion of action execution. Usually for runner that is blocked until the action execution is complete, the post run is handled by the runner container. For runner that is asynchronous, that post run needs to be invoked separately and specifically per runner.

Merge pull request #4421 from StackStorm/fix-orquesta-user-context

Fix cascade of workflow user context to orquesta tasks

Fix cascade of workflow user context to orquesta tasks

The orquesta workflow user context is not cascaded down to the tasks which lead to failure in accessing user content via the action service in python actions. This fix takes the user context from the workflow execution and pass it to the task execution and subsequently setting the user context in the liveaction.

Merge pull request #4400 from StackStorm/orquesta-with-items

Implement with items for Orquesta workflows

Update version of orquesta in requirements

Update the commit hash for orquesta in requirements to reference the required changes for with items task.
Fix minor flake8 errors
Publisher instrumentation

Add integration tests to cover pause, resume, and cancel for task with items

Add integration tests to cover cancellation, pause, and resume of orquesta workflows that have tasks with items.

Refactor workflow inspection unit tests

Refactor the workflow inspection unit tests to accomodate change in the workflow schema.

Fix race in concurrent scheduling of action executions for task with items

For a task with items schedules multiple action executions concurrently, there is a conflict in updating the DB record for the task execution. Add the retry decorator for requesting action executions to retry on conflict. Refactor with items tests to allow more granular control of concurrency.
Add unit and integration tests for orquesta with items

Add support of with items to orquesta workflows

Refactor workflow engine and service to add support of with items for orquesta workflows. The orquesta conductor adds more data when retrieving the next set of tasks for execution. The extra data includes one or more rendered action specs. Previously, there is only one action spec and it is rendered directly into the task spec. The workflow service is refactored to request the number of action executions as specified in the set of tasks returned from the conductor. Additional field is added into the DB model for task execution to indicate if it is with items. The action execution result for each item is stored differently in the task execution.
Instrument mongo and AMQP operations

Merge pull request #4327 from StackStorm/entry_point_api_endpoint_content_type_fix

Update action entry point API controller to return correct Content-Type response header
Add changelog entry

NGINX: Use 308 redirect rather than 301

Our default NGINX configuration redirects `http://` requests to `https://`. This uses a 301 redirect. When clients see this, they will either switch PUT/POST requests to GET, or they may continue with PUT/POST, but with no payload.

This change uses [HTTP 308](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/308) instead. The request method and body will be unchanged.

This will reduce confusion for people using custom code that targets `http://<ST2>/`, rather than `https://<ST2>`

Merge pull request #4309 from StackStorm/orquesta-inquiry

 Add inquiry support for orquesta workflows

Fix inquiry regression for mistral

Move the post run of base class until after the pause request in the inquiry runner post run method. The base post run makes a callback to Mistral. We want to complete any work in st2 before the mistral callback. Add the pending status to the inactive check in action service.

Remove inquiry service from st2common circular dependencies check

The inquiry service module references the runner container so it can get an instance of the runner to invoke post run.

Fix race between processing a pending execution and pausing parent

If the action execution goes into pending state at the start of the inquiry, then its parent workflow will also be paused. Previously, the pause request is executed in the run method before the pending status is updated for the action execution. This lead to race where the parent is stuck in pausing because the action execution is still running. The pause request is moved to the post run method in this patch so that the pending status for the action execution is already updated after run but before post run.

Add integration tests and fix race with resume on inquiry response

Add integration tests for using inquiry with orquesta. The integration tests cover basic, consecutive, parallel, and nested inquiries. Fix a race condition on inquiry response for nested inquiries. The resume of parent workflow is in conflict with the handling of action execution completion of the inquiry task.

Fix duplicate task execution on subworkflow completion

Fix a bug where after completion of a subworkflow, the next task is executed twice. This is caused by multiple suceeded event triggering the st2 workflow engine. The workflow engine processed the messages independently and resulted in duplicate executions. A lot more info and debug log entries are added as a result of identifying the root cause of this bug.

Remove pending status from completed states

The pending status is not considered a completed states. Therefore, the pending status is removed from LIVEACTION_COMPLETED_STATES. Fix action chain runner and unit tests that fail as a result of the removal.

Add inquiry support for orquesta workflows

Add support of inquiry to the orquesta workflow engine. Modify the existing inquiry runner and service to handle pause and ressume differently for orquesta workflows. Add unit tests to cover various inquiry use cases such as basic inquiry, consecutive inquiries, parallel inquiries, and inquiry nested in a subworkflow.

Move inquiry respond related functions to service module

Refactor the inquiry API endpoint and move related functions for responding to an inquiry into the inquiry service module. This allows for better reuse and unit testing. The design of inquiry API and DB models are not refactored. The functions in the inquiry service module will expect the inquiry API model.

just cause additional confusion and harder to actually find out the
actual metric name.

Add policy application to st2workflowengine

For action execution executing under the context of an orquesta workflow, apply any post run policies before handling action execution completion. A policy may affect the outcome of an action execution. Since st2notifier also apply policies, skip the process for orquesta related action executions.

Relocate handling of action execution completion to workflow engine

Implement queue consumer that can handle variable message types

Implement a new queue consumer that can handle variable message types. The corresponding message handler has a map that routes the message type to a specific handler function. The message handler for the workflow engine will use this variable message handler to handle workflow execution and completion of action execution associated with the workflow.

Add a work-around with kombu pickle serializer issue.

Under Python 3, decoding pickle messages with non-ascii data in the body
would fail with "UnicodeDecodeError" because str_to_bytes doesn't pass
encoding argument to the .encode() method which means it defaults to
'ascii' and fails.

With this workaround, we explicitly pass and use utf-8 encoding.

Beforehand, it was throwing
```
# Setup PYTHONPATH in bash activate script...
# Delete existing entries (if any)
sed -i '/_OLD_PYTHONPATHp/d' virtualenv-osx/bin/activate
sed: 1: "virtualenv-osx/bin/acti ...": invalid command code v

Add new ?output_type=[raw|event_source] and ?existing_only=[true|false]
query parameter filters to the action execution output API endpoint.

With ?output_type user can control if they want to receive the "raw"
output (default) or "event_source" output. Keep in mind that
"event_source" format might result in a slow response if action has
already produced a lot of data, because it means we need to call
json_encode on each ActionOutpuDB object.

With ?existing_only user can control if they want the API endpoint to
only return existing output produced by the execution so far and return
/ close the connection immediately. Keep in mind that this only applies
to the executions which are still running.

Fix race between task and action execution

Move the update of the task execution before the action execution is requested. Currently, the task execution is updated after the request and there are cases where the action execution completed very quickly and the completion of the action execution is processed first. When completion is processed, the task execution is also updated and this causees conflict with the previous task execution update.

Merge pull request #4203 from StackStorm/orchestra-logs

Add more logging for the workflow engine
Fix and simplify logging configs.

Add gunicorn logging config for all the API services which run under
gunicorn (st2api, st2auth, st2stream).

In production, those services run in a worker subprocess which is
managed by gunicorn master process. If we don't have a special
logging config file for gunicorn worker processes, some messages
which are produced by gunicorn workers are lost.

This makes debugging and other things a lot harder.

Conflicts:
	CHANGELOG.rst

Dedup logic in while loop for processing next tasks

Clean up logic and remove duplication of code.

Add support for action less task

For task with no action defined, handle the task execution properly and request next set of tasks.

Replace $ and _ symbols to ctx() for var reference

Replaced symbols `$` for yaql and `_` for jinja with function call using either `ctx().var` or `ctx(var)` to reference variables in workflow context.

Add integration test for workflow with cycles

There was a bug with inspecting workflow with cycles. Add an integration test to ensure the bug is fixed.
Update st2common requirements.txt

Add an action chain equivalent example for comparing latency

Add examples.chain-sequential for comparing latency with the orchestra counterpart examples.orchestra-sequential.

Add and update integration tests

Minor adds and updates to the set of integration tests.

Fix transport route for workflow execution on publishing create

On creation of the WorkflowExecutionDB, the message is not being routed to the workflow engine on Ubuntu Xenial. The route is fixed after changing the type of queue used.

Fix runners-tests in Makefile

Fix the Makefile command `make runners-tests`.

Add error handling for action execution request for task

Handle error(s) that occurr when requesting action executions for the starting or next set of tasks. Fail the task execution if the record has been created. Fail the workflow execution and log the error.
Add Makefile command to run orchestra integration tests

Clean up references to workflow test fixtures in unit tests

Move the references to the workflow test fixutres into the unit tests so it is easier to manage.

Ensure unicode data is passed correctly thru the workflow

Add unit and integration tests to ensure unicode data is passed correctly thru the workflow.

Include result in st2 execution get

Print the workflow output in st2 execution get. Currently, only the last task result is printed if the result contains task details.

Add output attribute to action execution result

Add output attribute to the action execution result. Write the workflow output to the output attribute.
Update dist_utils.py

Add orchestra to the st2common requirements

Add the orchestra repo to the st2common requirements file.

Refactor schema and rendering of vars

Update workflow examples, unit tests, and integration tests to support changes in the schema and rendering of workflow input, output, vars, and task publish. The schema for these variable sections in the orchestra workflow DSL is changed to list of key-value pairs.

Implement error handling for known cases

Implement error handling for known failures such as evaluation errors in workflow input, vars, and output and in task transition and publish. Include a number of unit and integration tests to cover these failures.

Implement pause and resume for orchestra runner

Implement operation to pause and resume workflow and cascade of status to and from subworkflows. Include related examples, unit tests, and integration tests.

Fix cascade of cancellation to parent with other subworkflows

If a workflow has multiple subworkflows and the cancellation is requested from one of the subworkflow, cancel the subworkflow and then cascade the request up to the parent workflow and have the parent workflow cancels the other subworkflows.

Cascade workflow cancellation to parent and subworkflows

When a workflow is canceled, cascade the cancellation to subworkflows. If the parent is also a workflow, ensure the parent is canceled.

Implement workflow cancellation for orchestra runner

Implement functionality to cancel and associated unit and integration tests.

Add stress test to integration tests

Add a similar stress test in Mistral for Orchestra.

Handle DB write conflict in the workflow service

For a workflow with parallel branches, it is possible for the workflow service to handle action execution completion for more than one tasks. When this happens, it is likely that a DB write conflict can occur. To resolve, the workflow service needs to catch the DB exception and then retry the logic to handle action execution completion. The logic is also divided into multiple atomic parts.

Refactor context management in the workflow service

The input, output, and context management are moved into the orchestra workflow library. Refactor the workflow service in st2 to let orchestra handle that.

Add orchestra workflow examples

Add examples for sequential workflow and another that fails inspection.

Implement handler for action execution completion

Implement a handler to be executed on completion of action execution. This handler will evaulate if task execution is complete and also interact with the workflow conductor to launch the next set of task executions. Currently, this function is implemented in the notifier service. The goal is to refactor the notifier service into a more generic action execution controller service.

Implement service for the workflow engine

Implement the workflow engine module, message transport requirements, and the launcher for the service.

Add method to request task execution in workflow service

Implement a method to request task execution in the workflow service.

Implement workflow service for requesting execution

Implement a common workflow service for requesting workflow execution.

Implement database model and access for task execution

Implement database model and access for task execution and inherit from the change revision control database model.

Refactor orchestra to use workflow conductor

Refactor the orchestra runner to use the workflow conductor. The workflow conductor separates the workflow definition, workflow graph, and task flow. The conductor also supports serialization of these different components.

Create workflow execution record in database

After workflow inspection passes, create a workflow execution record in the database and associate it with the liveaction record.

Add inspection of workflow definition in the runner

Add a step to inspect workflow definition before the runner executes the workflow.

Rename orchestra to orchestra_runner because it conflicts with the orchestra WF library.

sensor container.

When running in this mode, it's assumed that sensor process life cycle
and failover is handled by an external service so the sensor process
container exits immediately when a server crashes.

This is useful in scenarios where sensor process life cycle and failover
is handled by external service such as kubernetes.

Merge branch 'master' into fix/nginx-proxy-pass-uri

Fix nginx 'proxy_pass' directive can't use URI in regex location

Using regex for location doesn't allow to specify URI for  `proxy_pass` (with trailing slash).
```
nginx: [emerg] "proxy_pass" cannot have URI part in location given by regular expression, or inside named location, or inside "if" statement, or inside "limit_except" block in /etc/nginx/conf.d/st2.conf:87
```
More on this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21662940/nginx-proxy-pass-cannot-have-uri-part-in-location and https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21662940/nginx-proxy-pass-cannot-have-uri-part-in-location

Fix MongoDB successful connection logging.

Since pymongo 3.0, client.connect() method is not blocking anymore and
always successfuly returns. Connection is established lazily when a
first query / command is issued.

This means we incorrectly always logged "Successfully connected to
database" when a connection was not established yet and when subsequent
queries failed.

Update st2-generate-symmetric-crypto-key utilitu to use cryptography
primitives to safely generate a new random symmetric AES and HMAC key

Add new implementation of symetric_encrypt and symetric_decrypt
functions which utilize crypto primitives from cryptography library.

We are moving from keyczar to cryptography, because keyczar doesn't
support Python 3, but cryptography does.

NOTE: Those functions utilize cryptography library primitives, but they
follow the same approach as keyczar Encrypt() and Decrypt() methods so
they are fully compatible with keyczar key files and keyczar encrypted /
decrypted data.

Refactor the callback module for post run to be more generic

Refactor the callback module for runner post run to be more generic. Currently, the callback takes a REST endpoint as input argument. The callback module is abstracted to take other input arguments. In this patch, the entire liveaction database object is passed to avoid overcrowding the method signature. Unfortunately, the liveaction object that the runner reference to is out dated by the time the runner makes the post run and there are more than one references of the object in the runner container. The runner container and runner is refactored to ensure references objects are used and updated.

Add use_object_ids argument to the fixtures loader.

When this argument is True, we use object ids (primary keys) from
fixture files when saving objects in the database.

This allows us to re-create reproducible tests in cases when tests rely
on fixed ids without needing to mock a lot of things (mocking is error
prone and not robust in a lot of scenarios).

Merge pull request #3900 from StackStorm/python_runner_remove_db_dep

Remove MongoDB database dependency from Python runner
Update affected code, make the same code change for process container.
Update affected tests.

Remove database dependency from Python runner.

Python and other runners were refactored to be fully standalone and not
require db connection, but https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/pull/3658
PR inadvertently introduced DB dependency.

This PR works around that by only retrieving PackDB object from the
database if common libs functionality is enabled and ignore database
related errors.

Note: Common lib functionality is a new feature and is not needed on AWS
Lambada.

Fixed flake8 problem

Fix edge case for workflows stuck in running state

There is an edge case where mistral receives connection error from the st2 API when requesting action execution. When this happens, the action execution is requested twice. The first action execution is requested, the record is written into the MongoDB, but it is not published to the action runners. The second action execution is scheduled and the mistral workflow reach completion. The mistral querier for the st2resultstracker will see the first action execution in a non-completed state and assume the workflow is still running. This patch identifies this specific edge case and ignores the duplicate action execution.

Split datastore service into two classes:

1. One used by actions - this one doesn't need database access and uses

datastore service itself.

Update Python runner so it's now standalone.

This means that config is now passed to the runner and runner doesn't
need access to database anymore.

Config abstraction has now been moved one level higher and it's loaded
inside the runner container service. This abstraction is better anyway
because we can eventually also easily add support for configs to other
runners.

This parameter is not directly exposed via runner yaml file and is to be
used in environment where we don't have access to other st2 packages and
services such as database, etc.

Fixed bug in ActionChain runner where context_result wasn't updated properly

Inquiries play a bit of surgery with the liveactions behind the scenes, so when an ActionChain
resumes from a Inquiry pause, it correctly retrieves an updated result when it detects a state
change it didn't previously know about.

However, it doesn't update context_result, which is what ultimately gets passed into the Jinja
renderer. So this makes sure the appropriate task results is updated in context_result

Merge pull request #3746 from StackStorm/delete_output-queus

Make sure temporary stream output queues get deleted, make all queues used by the stream service auto deletable

Make all queues used by stream service auto_delete=True.

This way they get automatically deleted when stream is shut down. We use
random names for those queues so if we don't do that, they will stay
around when stream is restart (new queues get created on restart) and
nothing will consume from them hence we are left with zombie queues.

Make output queues exclusive and auto deleteable.

This way they are deleted after no one is consuming from them anymore.

Merge branch 'master' into bugfix/st2clean-database-config

Update execution output stream to utilize a single "generic" collection
for storing the output instead of utilizing two collections.

This approach makes whole thing more generic and makes it more
future-proof and work with other runner which doesn't necessary have two
streams (stdout, stderr).

Now "type" argument on the document stores type of the output and it
means each runner execution can produce as little or as many output
types as it needs.

Most of the existing runners will produce two type of output (stdout,
stderr), but it's likely that in the future we will have other runners
which will just produce one type of the output.

Merge pull request #3688 from StackStorm/fix-pack-async-exec-timeout

Fix timeout listening for events with client side async execution

Fix timeout listening for events with client side async execution

On pack install, the command listens for event from the API server. If the execution takes too long, the SSEClient which listens for events on the client side returns an empty string which leads to JSON load error.

Merge pull request #3684 from StackStorm/fix-mistral-querier

Refactor how mistral querier determines which tasks to query

Refactor how mistral querier determines which tasks to query

The use of last query time lead to edge cases where some tasks are not queried again. Instead of using the last query time, the task record stored in the liveaction result is compared to identified whether it needs to be retrieved again.

Merge pull request #3645 from StackStorm/action-chain-pause-resume

Implement pause and resume for Action Chain
Update change log to include the Action Chain pause and resume

Fix chain status when there are no more tasks and last task failed

Since chain status is set to failed by default, when there are no more tasks to run next and the last task failed, set chain status to failed.

Fix chain status when there are no more tasks

Since chain status is set to failed by default, when there are no more tasks to run next, set chain status to succeeded.
Fix minor typo in comment

Change default Action Chain status to failed

Change default Action Chain status to failed in case something unexpected fall thru.

Fix Action Chain unit tests

Mock the LiveAction in the runner container otherwise the unit tests will fail.

Save and restore context vars on Action Chain pause and resume

The context vars are saved unencrypted into the context of the liveaction for the Action Chain on pause and the context vars are restored on resume.

Add unit tests for init vars on Action Chain pause and resume

Ensure the init vars are restored properly when an Action Chain is paused and resumed.

Add unit test for context access on Action Chain pause and resume

Ensure the context result is saved and restored properly when an Action Chain is paused and resumed.

Fix publish vars display on pause and resume in Action Chain

Ensure the runner parameter for display published is restored properly on pause and resume.

Add integration tests for pause/resume of Mistral and Action Chain combos

Add integration test for pause and resume of Mistral workflow with an Action Chain. Add another one for Action Chain with a Mistral workflow.

Implement pause and resume for Action Chain

Action chain can be paused and resumed. Pause and resume will cascade down to subworkflows. If pause is initiated from a subworkflow, the pause will cascade up to the parent action chain. On the contrary, if resume is initiated from a subworkflow, the resume will not cascade up to the parent action chain.

Fix print in st2client when liveaction result does not exists

For Action Chain, if the liveaction does not have result yet, st2client throws attribute missing error on execution get.

Clean up constants and imports in action chain runner

Import the constant modules instead of listing the constants individually in the imports. Do the same for the imports of exception classes.

Merge pull request #3665 from StackStorm/fix/trace_sort_order

Fix: Sort order for trace API endpoint
Add change log entry for Mistral workflow pause and resume

Refactor container to handle operations consistently

Refactor container to handle run, cancel, pause, and resume more consistently. For example, have the runner return status, result, and context for these operations and refactor liveaction and execution status update into a common method.

Include default friendly error message in the runner pause/resume operations

Include a friendly error message in the NotImplementedError in the runner's pause and resume operations.

Return friendly error to user in the action execution API when pause/resume fails

The underlying error from action service is already a friendly error. Return that error instead on abort in the API.

Throw exception on unsupported liveaction status in runner container

If runner container is dispatching a liveaction with an unsupported status, throw a friendly exception.

Throw exception if result is provided on pause and resume of execution

In the PUT method of the execution API, if result is provided for pause and resume, throw a bad request exception.

Fail execution if children is missing on workflow pause and resume

When pausing or resuming a workflow, if the subworkflows or the children of the corresponding action execution is missing, then fail the workflow.

Fix pause and resume of mistral workflow using pause-before in definition

Pause from pause-before did not cascade up from subworkflows. This patch contains partial fix and also requires a corresponding upstream patch in Mistral. Additional integration tests are included to test this functionality.

Add integration test to pause/resume workflow with subworkflows

Add integration test to pause/resume workflow defined in workbook with subworkflows. The pause/resume should cascade down to the subworkflows.

Cascade pause and resume of subworkflow actions in Mistral workflow

If pause and resume is requested for a Mistral workflow, the request will cascade down to subworkflow actions. Subworkflow actions are st2 actions that are Mistral workflows. This patch does not currently subworkflows that are part of a Mistral workbook.

Implement pause and resume for Mistral runner

Mistral already supports pause and resume of workflow execution. This patch exposes the pause and resume functionality in the Mistral runner.

Change queue name to st2.preinit so it contains a st2 prefix and it's

Use consistent formatting.

Add ability to pre-declare all the used queues on service set up.

This is required when using worker model where all the services which
consume from queues might not already be online before the producers.

Because of the implementation details, this is not required with
RabbitMQ transport, but it's requires with some other transports such
as Redis one.

This feature can be enabled by setting messaging.predeclare_queues
st2.conf config option to True (False by default).

Fix invocation of Mistral workflow from Action Chain

If the parent action chain contains jinja expression in the execution parameters, the jinja expression will be included in the context begin passed into the Mistral subworkflow. Mistral will try to evaluate the expression when it is evaulating input args and if the expression contains references to local data context, the evaulation fails because the data context is already out of scope. This patch converts the jinja expression into raw jinja blocks when passing thru the context.

Modify CORS behaviour to work around browser security limitations

Generally, we should not allow using cookes for authentication without expressingly setting a limited number of allowed origins.

However, due to inconsistencies in browser implementations and the responsiveness of our community to the whole concept of CORS over the last few years, I'm inclined to say "the hell with it".

This is a little hack that allows us to work around the problem described in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19743396/cors-cannot-use-wildcard-in-access-control-allow-origin-when-credentials-flag-i.
Make cookies a fallback rather than a primary auth strategy

Constrain split on : to first instance

Fix workflow status when task is canceled

Fix Mistral workflow status when task is canceled. Currently, when a task is canceled, the workflow status is set to error. The workflow status should be set to canceled. Also, when a canceled action execution completes, the action execution will be updated from canceled to its new status. This should not be the case because the action execution has already been canceled.

Add support for nullable types

The flavor of jsonschema used in openapi prohibits use of `type: null`. At least one of our endpoints may get null value as an input. At that moment I'm not comfortable to change existing API behaviour so I had to add `x-nullable` schema properly that skips type validation if it's set to True and value of the prarmeter is None.

Signed-off-by: Matt Oswalt <oswaltm@brocade.com>

Initial work on fixing `st2 login` bug.

In st2client/base.py, there's a conditional that detects if the username and password
is provided, and if so, try to retrieve a token and update the token attribute of the
client before returning. However, in a traditional `st2 login` scenario, only the
'username' field is populated, so this code will never run.

Previous tests were done on systems that effectively had auth disabled (doh!), so while
the config file and token files were being changed/generated correctly, API requests
did not carry the 'X-Auth-Token' header. Since auth was disabled, this was no problem.
However, on a real installation, this feature just plainly did not work.

In short, this allows the 'st2 login' feature to work, and it also provides unit tests
to help prevent this kind of thing

Signed-off-by: Matt Oswalt <oswaltm@brocade.com>

Total re-vamp of login and whoami tests

The previous version of these tests were a bit too reliant on mock,
so this approach instead works with as few mocks as possible.

Support additional path requirements

The additional check helps avoid the situation when static portion of the path gets resolved as dynamic due to lack of ordering or priority during patch resolving.

An example of that situation will be an attempt to resolve a path (`/rules/views`) against two matching endpoints (`/rules/views` and `/rules/{ref_or_id}`). Depending on the dictionary order, the path may be resolved to either of two. The additional requirement helps us to stear the algorithm to a particular resolution.

Updated version of six to 1.10.0 to make sure its compatible with the
newer versions of steuptools.

This is to address https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/issues/3166

Add Response validation

When response would not match the scheme, the router will set a 'Warning' header to inform client that response could be malformed and requires additional client-side validation. We also check for the header during unit tests to try and catch regression earlier.

Signed-off-by: Matt Oswalt <oswaltm@brocade.com>

Added handler for single-element arrays without brackets

Issue #3157 (https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/issues/3157) reported
a problem with using single-element arrays as an action parameter thusly:

	st2 run foopack.fooaction arrayparam=51

This was because the transform_array function in actions.py first tries to
load the given value as JSON. In the example above, 51 is a valid int in JSON,
so this results in an error because of a mismatch between what the API expected
(array) and what was actually sent (int).

Note that this isn't a problem if the single element in this array is a string;
json.loads handles that just fine. However, if it's an int, this bug appears.

To get around this, the user **could** run something like:

	st2 run foopack.fooaction arrayparam=[51]

However, this is a bit unintuitive. Because of the action metadata, we already know
that this **should** be a list, so we can force it to be. So, this commit adds a
step to check if the value is an int, and if so, force it to be a Python
list. This allows the user to also use the more intutive former example.

Signed-off-by: Matt Oswalt <oswaltm@brocade.com>

Update changelog.

Add support for Jinja template notation for default parameter values for
parameters which type is object.

Note 1: We already supported it for strings and list, but we didn't support it for
objects.

Note 2: This change only adds support for objects with single level of nesting.
This is done intentionally to avoid potentially infinite loops and resource
exhaustion. It's the same story with lists - we only support rendering direct
list items.
Throw a more user-friendly exception.

Merge pull request #2856 from lakshmi-kannan/STORM-2246/custom_jinja_functions

Custom jinja functions
Update CHANGELOG again (typo)
Update CHANGELOG
Update docstring
Refactor _process method in util/param.py

Improve default chatops message rendering

* Fix a bug in format_execution_result.py where we were
  accidentally returning tuple instead of a single return
  value.
* Fix a bug where the jinja env was being created with
  allow_undefined=False and with jinja ``if`` blocks,
  this will never work because we expect some variables
  to be missing in execution object. So now I pass
  allow_undefined=True. Though this isn't ideal, we'd
  not blow up this action when template is malformed.
* Now edited the jinja template to include total
  time taken to execute using the new jinja filter
  ``to_human_time_from_seconds``.

Fix jinja rendering issue when filters are used

* If you use jinja filters like
  st2 run core.local cmd='echo {{"1.6.0" | version_bump_minor}}',
  we weren't rendering it correctly. This was due to a bug that
  in param_utils _process method which incorrectly decided that
  the expression isn't a valid jinja renderable one because there
  are no dependencies on other variables. Filters don't have
  dependencies on other variables yet is still a jinja expression.

Merge pull request #2738 from codyaray/patch-1

Support --register-fail-on-failure in st2ctl
Update the st2ctl in st2common as well

Support --register-fail-on-failure in st2ctl

The `--register-fail-on-failure` option that I [learned about yesterday|https://stackstorm-community.slack.com/archives/community/p1465382685000395] is pretty useful. We should expose this option through `st2ctl reload`.

Our content management story currently deploys packs with ansible and triggers `st2ctl reload --register-all` (and in some playbooks `--register-setup-virtualenvs` as well). So right now it fails silently if the content can't be loaded. Would be nice if we could just pass this flag through directly so it returns the error to ansible to display. 

Or you can say, no, just use the `st2-register-content` script directly for more flags. That's fine too. :)

Merge pull request #2569 from StackStorm/feature/st2-packages-branching

Add support for st2-packages branching (master)
Fixtures
Replacing `extras` with `extra`
hack-commit license attribution

Add the `extras` field to action aliases

Different chat adapters have special capabilities which are sometimes
very handy and nice. Slack has attachment colors and parsing/unfurling
options for better formatting; HipChat has Connect features; and so on.
Its hard for users to add support for those right now, because you
have to modify the schema and the DB connector in st2, and only then
submit a PR to `hubot-stackstorm` utilizing the new parameter. More
importantly, if we had a lot of requests for this, our schema would be
overblown with rarely used parameters.

A solution for this,which has been discussed some weeks ago, but I
only got around to it now,is an `extras` object inside the alias with
a free schema. It will allow people to easily add support for extra
features without modifying `st2` (which would imply only getting a
feature out in the next `st2` release and complicating the schema) and
with relative ease. While this is not ideal architecturally (a reason
the schema exists in the first place is to have order, and this breaks
it a bit), I feel like pros outweigh the cons, and its worth to
introduce this. We still maintain strict schema outside `extras`.

Another neat feature this PR includes is rendering extras with Jinja
sharing the context with `ack` or `result`, depending on the placement.
E.g. different colors depending on the execution status.

This can also be useful for possible usage of action aliases outside
chat (e-mails, sms, tweets, and whatnot).

An example:
```
name: "tesla.honk_horn"
action_ref: "tesla.honk_horn"
description: "Honk your horn"
formats:
- honk-honk
result:
format: "**Honk Honk**"
extras:
color: <% if result.succeeded %> green <% else %> red <% endif %>
```

Synchronize circle.yml with st2 CI process/versioning

- CircleCI build is triggered only when you push changes to `master` or `vX.Y` like `v0.13` branch
- CircleCI build is never triggered when you push changes in patch `vX.Y.Z` branch like `v0.13.3`
- Package version is always obtained from [`st2common/st2common/__init__.py`](https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/st2common/st2common/__init__.py#L16)
- Docker TAG is always:
   - `latest` for `master` branch
   - obtained from version [`st2common/st2common/__init__.py`](https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/st2common/st2common/__init__.py#L16) for branches like `v0.13`
   - See: https://hub.docker.com/r/stackstorm/st2api/tags/

You don't need to delete `circle.yml` file in patch version since that, but probably during time there will be small edits like Bintray -> Packagecloud switch or bugfixes.

Fix docs mentioning 9100 and 9101 ports

There will be a lot of confusion next couple of month related to this new schema and how port and path corelate and when you should use one or the other.

The rule of thumb I used while making this commit and suggesting you should use when in doubt is rather simple:

> `https://example.org/api` is a public url and should be used for external services talking to st2 (webhooks, browsers, off-server or potentially off-serverrunning services like hubot). `http://localhost:9101/` is a private url and should be used for testing or wiring between internal components (so it is ok to use it as a mock in tests, example when testing custom auth is properly set up or to route the request from nginx to st2api).

There's a ton of potentially tricky situations where it's not immediately clear whether it should be private or public url and we'll have to deal with each of them on a case by case basis.

And yeah, if you can avoid mentioning st2api url in examples that are not directly tied to wiring up the system, use some other url instead. 'http://httpbin.org/get' is a nice general purpose example url.

Consume all bytes from channel before decoding as utf-8

When consuming stdout and stderr byte streams from paramiko
channel, consume all the raw bytes and then decode. Decoding
chunk as they come won't work because utf-8 is variable
length encoding. When we want to support streaming, this
is going to be a pain.

Copy to avoid modifying the original collection

Somewhat better cluster management code.

* On a hard failure to connect to rabbit node Publisher tries to switch over
  to a different nodes. Also, it tries the entire cluster 2 times before
  entirely abandoing the request.
* Once a failure to publish a message is identified the execption is allowed
  to flow upwards. It is now apps responsibility to handle communication failures.

PoolPublisher sharing

* Sharing the PoolPublisher leads to connection sharing which should in theory
  make everyone happy. Looks like this does manage to reduce the number of
  connections.
* Fancy way to implement a singleton really since I am not a huge fan of singletons
  anyway but you know they are necessary.

Use Producer instead of ProducerPool

* Connection and channel management is possible with Producer. ProducerPool
  takes over the management leading to shadow ConnectionPool and presumably
  connections to which we get no access. Producer keeps the management under
  our control.
* Explicitly use the 'round-robin' strategy. Although a default making it
  explicit to avoid any ambiguiity and impact due to changing defaults.

Update execution object when liveaction is updated

Fixes: 1717

Several things were uncovered with this bug report.

1) A non UTF-8 string '\x82' in stdout causes mongo to throw an
exception when updating the results. We don't have a check
for validating if string is UTF-8 in document schema.
So this must be some mongo internal validation. We should
figure out if we can turn it off.

2) An exception thrown is caught by worker and liveaction
object is updated but the execution object is not. This
results in execution state shown as `running` even though
liveaction status is `failed`.

3) While fixing this, I also noticed that when an action is
canceled, we don't execute the execution object status to
`canceled` which also is consistent with the bug report.
Try to delete the virtualenv before creating it

Merge pull request #1758 from StackStorm/update-unload

Unregister rules and aliases if the pack is uninstalled

Unregister rules and aliases if the pack is uninstalled

* Leaving behind rules and action-aliases of a pack when the pack is incorrect.
  Removing all the content is the correct behavior.

Disable parallel execution of SSH actions

* Fabric doesn't behave well with eventlets especially when parallel is
set to True. Parallel basically executes a command on a bunch of hosts.
Parallel uses multiprocessing and calls fork(). We don't understand the
root cause yet. Fabric has other issues as well. So until we use
Paramiko straight and replace our SSH runner, let's disable parallel
SSH execution.

Additional detail on configuring trusted SSL CA

As reported in https://github.com/StackStorm/st2contrib/issues/240,
not all environments are treated equally. Many environment fall into a
scenario where a custom CA must be trusted by the OS and Applications,
or else validation will fail and connections will be rejected. To that
end, this commit adds detail on how to configure the underlying Python
`requests` library to load a custom SSL CA bundle into the OpenSSL trust
chain.

h/t @araline :tophat:

hash based partitioner implementation.

* Picked up a CRC variant has function from http://www.cs.hmc.edu/~geoff/classes/hmc.cs070.200101/homework10/hashfuncs.html
  and used that to implement partitioning.
* The idea is to be able to provide hash range to a sensor node and have the sensor node compute
  via the pre-determined algorthim whether to run the sensor or not. Since the hash itself is
  stable each sensor should always endup in a specific bucket.
* This scheme functions poorly if the no of sensors about the same as sensor nodes.

Merge pull request #1694 from StackStorm/powershell-configuration

Added PowerShell configuration section
Fix unit tests and some lint issues
shard renamed to partition

File based shard map

* File based makes it easy to use in dev enviornment as clean starts with no
  DB entries causes kvstore to fail. Also, kv store is not exportable.

Switch shard_provider to be a dictionary config

* Dictionary config makes it harder to do simpler thing but keeps ability
  to provide richer config to the shard provider open without defining
  a config schema upfront. In practice this will look ugly so will have to
  document this properly.
Load sensor shard from shard_loader

Sensor shard loading

* The idea is that it should be possible to run only a specific set of sensors
  i.e. shard on a sensor node.
* The way to achieve this is to provide each sensor container process a unique
  name and a shard provider. The sensor container would have to lookup its
  shard map using the provider.
* Initial implementation only supports default (no sharding) and kvstore based
  sharding where the shard map is stored in the kvstore. Obviously, this can be
  easily extended - it might even be possible to make this pluggable by using
  entry points however for now going the config route.
* Some unit tests, also update fixtures loader to support sensortype fixtures
Add new sharding config options

Repair failing pack installation

This PR fixes two bugs introduced in #1570 / #1571

* Double `.git` extension
* SSH protocol downloads via Git

In certain circumstances, the `repo_url` passed into the `packs.download`
action is returns a double `.git.git` extension. Contains fix to only
append `.git` suffix if doesn't already exist.

In #1570, the protocol for Git was changed from SSH -> HTTPS. In cases
where a git-helper is not installed (ref: st2workroom), the protocol
needs to be reverted to avoid credential prompts.

Merge pull request #1568 from StackStorm/0.12dev

fix version in master/st2common

Updating Pack Deploy Strategy

This commit introduces several new fixes for the existing Pack deployment
actions. Namely:

* Do not overwrite `config.txt` on existing pack installations
* Allow short `repo_url` for GitHub shortcuts (repo_url=StackStorm/st2contrib)
* Deploy from monorepo repositories and single-pack repositories
  - Introduces `subtree` flag, for used when packs are nested within top-level `packs` directory
* Tag each download with Git information
  - Used to introspect versions of deployed packs

updates tests

on_success to on-success

* actionchain already uses 'on-success' and similar therefore making
  sure that notification which can also exist in an actionchain task use
  'on-success'. All instances like Action & LiveAction can contain
  notfication schema have been updated for sake of consistency.
* The preferred value is 'on_success' however mistral DSL has already
  taken the approach to use '-' and not '_'. To avoid confusion and
  inconsistency to user better to stick with '-'.
* All the internal proeprties though use '_' since '-' being the 'minus'
  operator should not be used in a property name.

Skip render of payload

* A trigger payload can contain renderable tokens. These token could be due
  to actions executed on other StackStorm systems. This is a common pattern used
  in the CI/CD pipeline of StackStorm. All these tokens are specific to that
  StackStorm system and cannot be resolved or should not be since often those
  keys will not even be available.

Merge pull request #1360 from StackStorm/STORM-1218/execution-scheduler

Implement action execution scheduler
Relocate test util methods to MockLiveActionPublisher
Log unexpected exception in the worker for action runner
Update docstrings in MessageHandlers
Clean up LiveAction statuses in st2client
Clean up unit test in test_notifier
Clean up if statements in ActionExecutionDispatcher
Add type checking to QueueConsumer message

Fix multiple wait and start in launch scripts

Remove use of list comprehension in waiting and starting multiple components in launch scripts.
Add an option to wait for completion in the start method of MessageHandler

Remove update of runner info from scheduler

The runner info in LiveAction should only be updated from the worker executing the action.
Add requested state to check in mistral itests

Refactor scheduler to listen for liveaction with requested status

Instead of listening to the creation of the liveaction object, refactor the scheduler to listen on the "requested" status. This allows for more flexibility in the future to manage and schedule liveaction by status.

Implement QueueConsumer and MessageHandler

Process such as rules engine, action runner, scheduler, notifier, and results tracker follow similar design pattern. These processes are refactored to use the QueueConsumer and MessageHandler.

Move publishing of status to update_liveaction_status

Move the publishing of the LiveAction status to the common method update_liveaction_status. Add a publish flag in update_liveaction_status to disable publishing when necessary.

Refactor worker for action runner and scheduler

Keep worker for the action runner and scheduler separate. Until the scheduler has its own launcher, the auncher for the action runner will also run and wait for the scheduler to complete.

Refactor LiveAction to inherit state publishing feature

Implement a StatePublisherMixin in the transport publishers module. The
StatePublisherMixin contains functions to publish state to the message
queue. LiveAction publisher inherits from the StatePublisherMixin.
Create a publisher for state management

Implement action execution scheduler

Create a scheduling service that takes the action execution request, performs scheduling logic (placeholder), and dispatch to the action runner(s).

Introduce the "requested" status to live action

The "requested" status is the technically the same as the current "scheduled" status. The schedule method in the action service is renamed to request. These changes pave the way for an actual scheduler.

Add execute method to action service

Move the execute_action from the action runner worker to the action service.

Merge pull request #1431 from StackStorm/packs-verify-ssl

Allow option to bypass SSL Certificate Check

Allow option to bypass SSL Certificate Check

The recommended behavior is to have all certificates checked for
validity before performing a clone. However, there are times when
this is outright not possible (development with a self-signed cert,
for example).

This commit updates the `packs.download` command, introducing a new
attribute `verifyssl`. By default, the behavior is to continue checking
SSL certificate validity, but now it is possible to clone with an
invalid certificate and proceed along without a care in the world.

Be careful using this... especially in the context of Infra as Code.

Delay invocation of runner generated auth token for async runner

Deletion of the runner generated auth token is delayed until the token expires. Async actions such as Mistral workflows uses the auth token to launch other actions in the workflow. If the auth token is deleted here, then the actions in the workflow will fail with unauthorized exception.

Pass runner generated auth token to Mistral

Pass runner generated auth token to Mistral

When auth is turned on, in order for Mistral to be able to launch st2 actions, the API calls to st2 from Mistral requires a token. The runner container generates a temporary token for authenticated calls. This auth token is passed to Mistral under st2_context in the environment on workbook and workflow execution.

Merge pull request #1173 from StackStorm/STORM-1121/fix-reload-verbose

Add verbose flag to register content in st2ctl

Add verbose flag to register content in st2ctl

By default, register content will only output logs that has level ERROR
or above. If "-v" or "--verbose" is included, the log level will change
to DEBUG.

Examples:
st2ctl reload -v
st2ctl reload --verbose
st2ctl clean -v
st2ctl clean --verbose

Merge pull request #973 from StackStorm/fix_bug_http_runner

RFR: New trigger should be created for each rule with different trigger parameters
Update CHANGELOG

New trigger should be created for each rule with different trigger parameters

Currently, we don't create a trigger for each rule. This results in parameters
being equal for all triggers. The behavior we want is to reuse the same trigger
if the parameters are same. If they are different, we want a new trigger to be
created.

* _get_trigger_api_given_rule in st2common/services/triggers now returns the right
 trigger API object.

Merge pull request #966 from StackStorm/remove-contrib-sandbox

Remove contrib/sandbox

Remove contrib/sandbox

The contrib/sandbox directory is replaced with the st2incubator repo.

Transform mistral workbook definition

Allow user to define workbook in native DSL without the st2.action
proxy. Before action execution, st2 transforms the workbook definition
and adds the st2.action proxy to appropriate actions before creating and
updating the workbook in Mistral.

Add utility function to transform mistral workbook

The utility function takes a mistral workbook written in native DSL and
wraps st2 action with the st2.action proxy.

Before Transform:
```
name: 'examples.mistral-basic'
version: '2.0'
description: 'Basic mistral workflow example'
workflows:
    demo:
        type: direct
        input:
            - cmd
        tasks:
            run-cmd:
                action: core.local cmd={$.cmd}
                publish:
                    stdout: $.stdout
                    stderr: $.stderr
```

After Transform:
```
name: 'examples.mistral-basic'
version: '2.0'
description: 'Basic mistral workflow example'
workflows:
    demo:
        type: direct
        input:
            - cmd
        tasks:
            run-cmd:
                action: st2.action
                input:
                    ref: core.local
                    parameters:
                        cmd: $.cmd
                publish:
                    stdout: $.stdout
                    stderr: $.stderr
```

Prettify action execution output in CLI

Add CLI options to "st2 execution get" for displaying execution result. By default, the output will print the status and result of the action execution as text. If given "-d" option, the command will print the full detail of the action execution in table format. If given "-k <key name>", the command will select the given key in the result dict and print the value. Dot notation for nested dicts is supported.

```
$ st2 execution get 547fb3691e2e24089440d49f
STATUS: succeeded
RESULT:
{
    "localhost": {
        "failed": false,
        "stderr": "",
        "return_code": 0,
        "succeeded": true,
        "stdout": "PING 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from 127.0.0.1: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.015 ms
64 bytes from 127.0.0.1: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.024 ms
64 bytes from 127.0.0.1: icmp_seq=3 ttl=64 time=0.030 ms

--- 127.0.0.1 ping statistics ---
3 packets transmitted, 3 received, 0% packet loss, time 1998ms
rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.015/0.023/0.030/0.006 ms"
    }
}

$ st2 execution get 547fb3691e2e24089440d49f -j
{
    "status": "succeeded",
    "result": {
        "localhost": {
            "failed": false,
            "stderr": "",
            "return_code": 0,
            "succeeded": true,
            "stdout": "PING 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) 56(84) bytes of
data.\n64 bytes from 127.0.0.1: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.015 ms\n64
bytes from 127.0.0.1: icmp_seq=2 ttl=64 time=0.024 ms\n64 bytes from
127.0.0.1: icmp_seq=3 ttl=64 time=0.030 ms\n\n--- 127.0.0.1 ping
statistics ---\n3 packets transmitted, 3 received, 0% packet loss, time
1998ms\nrtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.015/0.023/0.030/0.006 ms"
        }
    }
}

$ st2 execution get 547fb3691e2e24089440d49f -d
+-----------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| Property        | Value                                                        |
+-----------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| id              | 547fb3691e2e24089440d49f                                     |
| action          | core.ping                                                    |
| callback        |                                                              |
| context         | {                                                            |
|                 |     "user": "stanley"                                        |
|                 | }                                                            |

Use eventlet.sleep inside TriggerWatcher and give other green threads a chance
to perform their work.

If we don't do that, ConsumerMixin will block on waiting a message on a queue,
which means TriggerWatcher will block the whole process and will only work
correctly if it's running in a standalone process (aka won't work with the
sensor wrapper).

The action content_pack is auto-assigned to default if not provided on create. This is inconsistent on update as the API throws exception on the same action metadata file. So if content_pack is not provided on update, the content_pack currently assigned to the action in the database is used.

Merge pull request #653 from StackStorm/STORM-670/dup-history

Fix duplicate history record

Fix duplicate history record

Action execution is processed for each create and update events. Original method that process the events create history record if nonexistent. Race condition is possible where two separate events for the same action execution are processed simultaneously. The fix has the update wait for the history record and only creates a new history record on timeout.
